card.note: Always has the best one-liners... and the best Dad!
card.author: Chris

card.note: One thing I like most about Al, is that while we hang out jabbering away he sits quietly, and then out of nowhere will softly say the funniest comment of the night!
card.author: Devon

card.note: What I like best...when he comes home from Florida he always has a bright smile for our Summer & Fall. /RWhat I value most...his generosity of personal time on our final day at our restaurant. /RWhat I am grateful for...his son, daughter and wife. We love you eternally
card.author: Megan & Frankie Carozza

card.note: I miss your Fearrie's pizza!! Wishing you all the very best on your birthday and hope this finds you doing well and enjoying the best years of your life.
card.author: Vincent Jones

card.note: The one thing I like most about Mr. Albert Brown is his kindness. /R/RYou've always made me feel like I'm part of the family. Happy 75th birthday! Cheers to many more.
card.author: Michelle Bailey (Chris's friend :0)

card.note: He's been a major part of our lives forever. We love to take sightseeing trips with him. Carl and he make great partners and oh yes, he put up with my sister for 48 years... or maybe she put up with him. Happy 75th!
card.author: Carl and Pat

card.note: Hey brother, do you remember the time (I believe it was the summer of 1960) that your driving safely got us through the smokey fires ravaging PEI (with the help of some mounties) on our way to meet the ferry./R
card.author: Len

card.note: Hey Al. Remember the nights we went out in Dads truck to plow snow, you driving and I on the old hand pump to raise and lower the plow. Remember plowing all the dead ends off of Lowell St like Plymouth, Dustin and Pilgrim Roads. Did we ever get to skip school after?
card.author: Len

card.note: don,t rush me !!!! I'm thinking...................
card.author: J.A.B.

card.note: Hey al, do you remember ??? I do'nt !!!!!bro
card.author: bro,JO

card.note: Al has been a great member of our family for nearly 50 years. We have even travelled with him on many occasions, Charleston, Nashville, and the national parks of the mountain west. Love him lots, Don't play cribbage with him , he always wins. Love you Al!
card.author: Pat and Carl

card.note: Albie: /R I guess you're an "ok" brother - after all, I have four!!!! However, I do love that you are such a good grandpa to Izzy and Maren. They are very fortunate. Happy "big" birthday from your "big" sister./RP.S. We are all so jealous of your nice hair!
card.author: Love, Malzie

card.note: As a Brother, you rank High/RAs a Husband, you rank Higher/RAs a Father, you rank Highest/RAs a Grandfather, you rank/RThe Best!!!/RHappy Birthday
card.author: Love, Helen

card.note: The one thing that we like most about Uncle Al is the twinkle in his eyes, along with his warm smile. Although we don't get to see Uncle Al as often as we'd like, we know and remember him by that kind and loving look - and also by calling us "Dear" :)
card.author: Love, Laurie & Lyndsey

card.note: Al, /RThinking of all the laughs we had when you stayed with us years ago. Remember, you and Tom were sleeping. It was late. My mother and the dog were leaving. I slammed her fingers in the trunk. I woke you up to drive my car because I had to drive hers! Enjoy #75!
card.author: Love, Nona

card.note: Al, /RHappy Birthday to my older brother, who along with the help of an accomplice, a.k.a. Bobby Ducker, locked me in the pigeon coop! "Very Funny". Well, who's laughing now bro? I am the younger one. Always have been and always will be, because I am THE BABY!!!
card.author: Wicky wicky wi wi - a.k.a. Tommy

card.note: I've always appreciated how selfless he is. I remember going fishing with Al as a boy, how he patiently taught me the tricks and techniques he knew but not really getting to do much fishing of his own. His caring and concern for others is inspiring. Thanks Al, love you
card.author: Tom Griffith

card.note: My favorite memories of Uncle Al are of the countless "spirited" cribbage games at Grammy and Grampy's house. The visit wasn't complete until he and his brothers played a few dozen games. It was so much fun for me to watch, listen to, and sometimes even join in.
card.author: Krissy

card.note: I've always loved your sense of humor!
card.author: Jason Griffith

card.note: Al Brown Al Brown he's a hell of a guy/RAnd he sure can make a great pizza pie./RWith two great kids /RAnd one great wife/RHe's had such a wonderful life!/RSo 3 cheers to the man /RWho can drain an oil pan/RAnd we hope to see him at 95!!/R
card.author: B Leavitt

card.note: I love you Papa because you are always willing to play with me; and you make me laugh!
card.author: Izzy

card.note: I love you Papa because you play baseball with me; and you cuddle with me.
card.author: Maren

card.note: Dad, I love your quiet and gentle way combined with your clever sense of humor.
card.author: Michelle

card.note: Happy Birthday to the best Father-in-law a guy could ask for.
card.author: David

card.note: Al's Yankee ingenuity, you can fix your exhaust with Coors Light Cans!
card.author: Chris Lawton

card.note: Happy Birthday to a wonderful man with a wonderful family! Xoxo
card.author: Sarah Wickenden
